title: Love Island Australia's new hunk - soldier-turned-model Aaron Deacon Shaw
text:
Four ladies were left single on Thursday's 'recoupling' on Love Island Australia.

Now a new guy, Aaron Deacon Shaw, is set to enter the villa.

The former soldier-turned-model, 27, has served in the United States and Afghanistan.

Scroll down for video

'I'm coming for you girls!' Meet Love Island Australia's new hunk Aaron Deacon Shaw (pictured) who is set to enter the villa

Aaron was seen in Thursday's episode making a suave entrance into the villa, where he said: 'I definitely think all the boys will be worried that I'm turning up.'

'When I go through those doors in the villa I've got no competition. I'm coming for you girls,' he added.

The Gold Coast based hunk, who comes from a family of five brothers and one sister, has been single for the past year and hopes to find love in the villa.

Man in uniform: The solder-turned-model has served in the United States and Afghanistan

The addition of Aaron comes after the 'Bomb Squad' - Angel Ellis-Holley, Biancca Rose, Jordan Cayless, Téa Fraser and Isabelle Green - stormed the villa last week.

The ladies spent three days getting to know the boys - Adam Farrugia, Josh Packham, Gerard Majda, Eoghan Murphy and Matt Zukowski.

Unfortunately, they couldn't break up fan favourite couple Cartier Surjan and Adam who were finally reunited during the 'recoupling' after the 'Bomb Squad' failed to tempt Adam into cheating.

Shaking up the villa: Aaron was seen on Thursday's episode making a suave entrance into the villa, where he said: 'I definitely think all the boys will be worried that I'm turning up'

'I'm back!' Adam exclaimed as he raced over to hug Cartier during the 'recoupling'.

'It wasn't a hard decision for me at all,' he said. 'They're all nice girls, the Bomb Squad, but no one can beat her [Cartier].'

Josh and Gerard also returned to their respective ladies, Anna and Cynthia, while Eoghan left Jessie for Wynter for Jordan.

Love Island Australia continues on Sunday at 8:30pm on Channel Nine
description: Four ladies were left single on Thursday's recoupling Love Island Australia after The Bomb Squad.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
